headline: Helping DFW Chiropractors never miss a call | LeadsAlive.AI – From wall-phone kid answering for my doctor dad to AI Receptionist builder
about:
You think owning a clinic means the phone owns you.
It doesn't have to.
You’re at your daughter’s game—phone in pocket, praying it stays quiet.
When it rings, you walk away from the family. Again.
That buzz could be three hundred bucks.
And each time you choose the call… your kid notices.
You’ve tried voicemail.
I know—you lost two patients in one weekend because of it.
Big gurus won’t admit it—voicemail isn’t a gatekeeper, it’s a graveyard.
The phone doesn’t need to own you.
What works is letting the calls get answered for you—24/7—without you lifting a finger.
Every ring books itself. No more “maybe later.”
Tested with Dallas area travel and insurance agencies.
One booked four trips in fourteen days—zero extra work.
The insurance crew closed five policies—twelve hundred fifty in premium—from Saturday calls.
Same AI, now tuned for DFW chiropractors.
→ Forward your number.
→ Calls ring straight to my AI—not your pocket.
→ They book the slot, send you the text, and the ringing stops.
If you're a DFW chiropractor sick of missing calls and family time, DM me the word "QUIET" and I’ll send you the 3-question setup.

about:
Most B2B companies don't have a revenue problem. They have a revenue operations problem. I fix it.

I'm Sumit Nautiyal, and over the past 14+ years I've helped 300+ B2B companies ($20M-$200M ARR) turn chaotic growth into predictable revenue engines.

THE RESULTS THAT MATTER

→ $10M+ in pipeline generated for B2B SaaS clients

→ 30%+ reduction in CAC through funnel optimization
→ 10x boost in sales efficiency with AI & automation
→ 150+ GTM & RevOps implementations across 4 continents

Featured as Economic Times Speaker on AI & Sales Automation.

THE PROBLEM I SOLVE

You're growing, but it feels chaotic:

→ Sales and marketing aren't aligned
→ Your CRM is a mess (or underutilized)  
→ You can't accurately forecast revenue
→ Pipeline is unpredictable
→ CAC is climbing, conversion is dropping

Sound familiar?

WHAT I DO DIFFERENTLY

I architect full-funnel revenue systems that turn chaos into clarity:

GTM Strategy & Execution
→ Market entry, ICP definition, positioning

RevOps Infrastructure

Pipeline Engineering

Sales Enablement
→ AI-powered playbooks, training, content systems

Marketing Operations
→ Campaign automation, attribution, performance tracking

Tech Stack Integration
→ HubSpot, Salesforce, Outreach, Clay, n8n, and 40+ tools

MY APPROACH
1. Diagnose revenue leaks across your entire GTM motion
2. Design systems that align teams around one source of truth
3. Implement AI-powered processes that scale with your growth
4. Optimize continuously based on data, not opinions

TYPICAL OUTCOMES (90 Days)

→ 30-50% faster sales cycles
→ 20-40% higher pipeline conversion  
→ 50-75% fewer revenue data errors
→ 2-3x better forecast accuracy
→ One unified system everyone actually uses

WHO I WORK WITH

→ B2B SaaS companies ($2M-$20M ARR)
→ Tech services firms scaling their sales
→ Founders & GTM leaders tired of guessing

READY TO SCALE?

Book a call: https://meetings.hubspot.com/devcommx/consultation-with-devcommx

Email: sumit@devcommx.com

Follow for daily insights on GTM strategy, RevOps, and AI sales automation

updates.postText:
GPT + n8n + Clay = $1.2M pipeline in 90 days
 
Just the flow.

We didn’t hire 5 SDRs.
We didn’t spend $20K on paid ads.
We didn’t spray 50,000 cold emails.

We built a signal-led, AI-powered outbound system that did one thing right:
→ Sent the right message to the right person at the right time.

Here’s exactly how it worked ↓

Step 1️⃣: Signal Detection
We used Clay + Clearbit to monitor:
→ LinkedIn job changes
→ Website activity
→ Recent funding
→ Tech installs
→ Post engagement

Every signal was matched with our ICP filters.

Step 2️⃣: Lead Enrichment + Personalization
Clay + #Apollo stacked to enrich every contact.
Then GPT-4 kicked in:
→ Read their recent posts
→ Analyzed tone
→ Personalized the first line + subject line
→ Matched messaging to funnel stage

Step 3️⃣: Multi-Channel Outreach
With n8n as the brain, we deployed outreach across:
→ Email
→ LinkedIn DMs
→ Retargeting Ads
→ Slack alerts (for hot leads)

Every message adapted dynamically based on the buyer’s response (or silence).

Step 4️⃣: AI-Powered Reply Handling
Our GPT agents handled mid-thread replies:
→ Objections
→ Interest signals
→ Meeting coordination
→ No manual intervention

Step 5️⃣: Meeting Booking + CRM Sync
Once booked, the AI dropped a detailed buyer brief into HubSpot
→ Context
→ Pain points
→ Channel history
→ Suggested CTAs for closers

What did we get?
• 31 SQLs
• $1.2M in pipeline
• $0 on outbound headcount
• 90% automation, 10% human handoff

And guess what?
→ This same system is now deployed across 4 of our client GTM engines.

If your outbound still looks like this:
▪️CSV upload
▪️Generic follow-ups
▪️Manual LinkedIn messages

It’s time to evolve.

Drop “PIPELINE” below
I’ll send the full Notion playbook we used stack, logic, workflows, even objection-handling prompts.

Follow Sumit N. | VP GTM @ DevCommX
For no-fluff GTM systems, RevOps strategy, and AI-led growth playbooks.

#AIOutbound #GTM #SalesAutomation #n8n #Clay #ColdEmail #LinkedInSelling #GPT4

I didn’t build a sales team. I built an AI sales agent.

And it’s brilliant.
Let’s be real: most early-stage teams don’t fail because of bad products.
They fail because they can’t scale outbound.

We were on the edge of that cliff — until we changed our approach.

Instead of hiring 3–5 SDRs, we built an AI-powered sales agent.

Here’s how it works, and why it’s outperforming most human teams:

🧱 Step 1: AI-Powered CRM Assembly
We asked GPT-4 to help us define exactly who we want to pitch to:
	Role titles
	Industry verticals
	Growth stage
	Signal triggers (hiring, funding, tech changes)

Then, using Clay + Clearbit + Crunchbase, we trained the AI to:
→ Scrape relevant accounts
→ Verify them via email & LinkedIn
→ Enrich each record with role-specific context

The CRM now refreshes itself. No data team. No weekly list builds.

✍️ Step 2: Auto-Personalized Outreach
We trained ChatGPT on our:
	Offers
	Value props
	Case studies
	Brand voice

Then layered on Relevance AI + Notion to:
→ Generate 1:1 intros per account
→ Segment CTAs based on role & stage
→ Preload first touches into Smartlead

Every email feels hand-written.
Even though it’s not.
🔁 Step 3: Multi-Channel Sequencing

Our agent runs synchronized plays across:
	Email (Smartlead: rotating domains + automated warmups)
	LinkedIn (HeyReach.io: soft DMs, no spam)
	Retargeting (Custom Facebook/Google audiences for touched accounts)

We get 7–9 touches in per lead, with zero manual chasing.

When a prospect clicks, replies, or connects:
→ Zapier tags them in HubSpot
→ AI routes them to our BDR (Jony)
→ Slack pings us to jump in if needed

☕ Step 4: Human Handoff for Qualified Leads
This is where it shines.

The agent doesn’t just book random meetings.
It nurtures, qualifies, and engages before we step in.

When Jony or I jump into a call, the prospect already:
	Knows who we are
       Has read 2–3 posts
	Has seen our offer breakdown
	Is ready to explore implementation

We don’t pitch. We prescribe.

📈 Results So Far
	Weekly outreach capacity: 4,000+ contacts
	Reply rate: 12%
	Booked meetings: 35+ per month
	Time spent prospecting manually: Zero
	Headcount added: None

We’re closing more, talking to better-fit buyers, and spending more time on calls — not chasing them.

Final Thought:

Everyone’s trying to scale with headcount.
We’re scaling with systems.

AI doesn’t replace the relationship.
It just clears the path so your team can build it faster.

💬 Want our full playbook on how we built this AI agent?

Comment “AI SDR” and I’ll DM you the doc with:
	Tool stack
	Prompts
	Workflows
	CRM logic
	Metrics to track

No more spray-and-pray.
It’s time to engineer your GTM.

#GTM #RevOps #AISales #OutboundAutomation #Smartlead #Clay #B2BSaaS #LeadGeneration #SalesSystems DevCommX

I book 80+ qualified meetings/month using AI SDRs.

And I haven’t touched a lead list in weeks.

All automated. All real-time. All under $200/month.

about:

I build automated outbound systems that combine Email + LinkedIn to get consistent meetings.

My background isn't just sales—it's system architecture.

Honestly, I think most companies get outbound completely wrong. They treat it as a brute-force activity. They hire more SDRs, send more generic spam, and hope something sticks. But all that does is burn through your TAM and annoy potential buyers.

I treat outbound as an engineering problem.

By combining AI, Clay, and data orchestration, I build systems that generate revenue on autopilot without the manual grind.

But here's the reality: not every company needs the same level of complexity.

If you're a Founder looking for speed, you need execution.
If you're a Sales Leader at a mid-market firm, you need infrastructure.

👇 CHOOSE YOUR PATH

FOR SMBs & FOUNDERS: Lumos (lumosco.ai)

If you need leads yesterday, you don't have time to master complex tools or manage an expensive team. You just need a partner to handle the execution so you can focus on taking the meetings.

• Done-for-you LinkedIn outreach starting at $297/mo.
• We handle the heavy lifting: list building, copywriting, and campaign management.
• You get a consistent stream of leads delivered to your inbox while you focus on closing deals.

Custom GTM Engineering & Clay Workflows

headline: Global Head of Talent Acquisition | Building & Leading TA Teams Across AMER, LATAM, EMEA & APAC | Executive & Sales Recruiting | Financial Services & Consulting
addressWithCountry: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
about: I've spent 25+ years building and running global recruiting organizations—the kind that scale across time zones, navigate difficult stakeholders, and deliver when the pressure's on.I'm not just a strategist who delegates recruiting to a team. I still get my hands dirty with executive searches, close senior candidates who have multiple offers, and have those uncomfortable conversations with hiring managers when their expectations don't match reality.What I bring to the table:GLOBAL TA LEADERSHIPI've led recruiting teams of 100+ across North America, LATAM, EMEA, and India. I know what it takes to manage recruiters in different regions, deal with cultural differences, and keep everyone aligned when priorities shift. I've opened delivery centers, managed cross-border hiring compliance, and built regional recruiting teams from scratch.WORKING WITH DIFFICULT STAKEHOLDERSLet's be honest—not every executive is easy to work with. I've partnered with demanding Sales VPs, impatient Delivery leaders, and founders who want to hire someone yesterday for half the market rate. I've learned how to manage up, push back respectfully when timelines are unrealistic, and maintain trust even when I have to deliver bad news.HANDS-ON EXECUTIVE RECRUITINGI don't just oversee recruiting—I personally run searches for C-level roles, practice leaders, and sales executives. I source passive candidates, build relationships over time, and close deals when candidates are weighing multiple offers. I understand the nuances of recruiting for client-facing roles in consulting and financial services.BUILDING RECRUITING INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SCALESI've implemented ATS systems globally (Greenhouse expert, ATLAS for recruiting & sales integration, currently evaluating Ashby), created workforce planning models tied to sales pipelines, and built data-driven hiring processes that actually improve decision-making. I stay current with AI-powered sourcing tools (Juicebox, GEM, Pin, Wrangle, Clay) and know how to integrate them into workflows that recruiters will actually use—not just pile on more technology. I've also managed agency partnerships, vendor relationships, and compliance across multiple jurisdictions.Industries: Financial Services, Capital Markets IT, Consulting, IT Services, TechnologySpecialties: Executive recruiting, sales & client-facing roles, global team leadership, stakeholder management, delivery center buildouts, data-driven TA strategy

experiences.title: Talent Advisory Lead
experiences.jobDescription:
Founded a boutique talent advisory practice working with VC-backed startups and consulting firms on their toughest recruiting challenges—usually C-level hires, sales leadership, or roles they've been trying to fill for months.

• Personally run executive searches from sourcing through close, often competing against larger firms with bigger teams
• Leverage AI-powered sourcing tools (Juicebox, GEM, Wrangle, Pin.com and Clay) to identify and engage passive candidates at scale while maintaining personalized outreach
• Coach founders and hiring managers through realistic expectations on timelines, compensation, and what "top talent" actually looks like in their market
• Have those difficult conversations when their job requirements don't align with what candidates want or what the market will bear
• Build long-term talent pipelines using modern sourcing platforms and CRM functionality rather than one-off transactional placements

experiences.title: Head of Talent Acquisition
experiences.jobDescription:
Led global talent acquisition for a fast-growing IT services firm across North America and LATAM. Reported to the COO and partnered directly with Sales and Delivery VPs who had aggressive targets and weren't always easy to work with.

• Managed global recruiting operations while personally recruiting for high-profile client-facing and delivery leadership roles
• Implemented Greenhouse ATS globally despite initial resistance, improving recruiter productivity 40% and reducing time-to-hire 20%
• Integrated AI sourcing tools (GEM, Pin, Wrangle) with Greenhouse to automate candidate pipeline building and reduce manual sourcing time by 50%
• Trained recruiting team on modern sourcing techniques combining AI tools with traditional relationship-building approaches
• Navigated constantly shifting priorities from executives—learned to manage up effectively and keep the team focused when goals changed weekly
• Built workforce planning models tied to sales pipeline so we weren't scrambling every time a deal closed
• Created data dashboards executives actually used: quality of hire metrics, time-to-fill, source effectiveness, forecast accuracy
• Standardized leadership hiring process (structured intakes, calibrated scorecards, close plans) which improved decision quality on senior roles

experiences.title: Director North America Talent Acquisition & Recruiting
experiences.jobDescription:
Ran North American recruiting for a global financial services consulting firm with aggressive growth targets and demanding stakeholders across Sales, Delivery, and executive leadership.

• Built and led recruiting teams that consistently exceeded annual hiring targets even when goals increased mid-year
• Partnered with Sales and Delivery leaders who had conflicting priorities and tight deadlines—became skilled at managing competing demands
• Staffed new client engagements before contracts were signed by working closely with sales teams to forecast hiring needs
• Coached recruiters on working with difficult hiring managers, communicating at the executive level, and closing senior candidates
• Introduced forecasting discipline that aligned recruiting capacity with actual business demand instead of reactive firefighting

experiences.title: Director of Recruiting

• Scaled critical client delivery team from 20 to 150 employees in 18 months while maintaining quality standards
• Juggled high-volume hiring with targeted leadership searches—required constant prioritization and stakeholder management
• Recruited account managers and client-facing leaders who drove retention and expansion
• Worked directly with executive leadership to align hiring strategy with gr

headline: 🚀 From “paid leads we never touched” → 5–12 replacement estimates in 90 days from old ServiceTitan data | Database reactivation first (Housecall Pro included)
jobTitle: Founder — Lead Revival & Database Reactivation & Speed to Lead Engineer
about: Here’s why you’re paying for more and more leads… yet still can’t keep up when the heat hits.In July, the call board is full, people are on hold, and your system (usually ServiceTitan — Housecall Pro shops included) keeps filling up faster than you can work it. You look busy, but you’re burning ad spend on low-value calls while real revenue slips through the cracks.Most advisors say “answer faster,” buy a call centre, or pour more money into ads. That fills your board — but your database still becomes a graveyard of missed opportunities.The real problem isn’t a lack of leads — it’s weak, inconsistent follow-up on the leads you already paid for. Instead of chasing more leads, I start by reactivating the ones sitting in your ServiceTitan (or Housecall Pro). If you don’t fix your follow-up system first, nothing else actually plugs the holes in your sales process.In well-run HVAC reactivation programs, 5–15% of old leads typically book — and 20–40% of those estimates become full system replacements, often worth $12k–$20k each. That’s why I prove replacement revenue in your database first, before you spend another dollar on ads.Here’s how it works:→ First, we test about 500 old ServiceTitan (or Housecall Pro) leads to prove results.→ Then, we scale reactivation across your database and optimize bookings.→ Finally, we add fast follow-up on your newest leads.Most companies see booked estimates within 30–90 days.If you’re a ServiceTitan HVAC owner in a hot state struggling with wasted ad spend on untouched leads, DM me REACTIVATE and I’ll run a free small-sample test on your database to get you quick wins.

experiences.title: Founder — Lead Revival & Database Reactivation & Speed to Lead Engineer
experiences.jobDescription:
At Compass Online Marketing, we help home service businesses turn unconverted leads into booked sales appointments using AI-powered reactivation strategies.

At Compass Online Marketing, I help hot-state HVAC companies using ServiceTitan (and Housecall Pro) turn “dead” CRM leads into booked replacement opportunities — starting with database reactivation before spending another dollar on ads.

Most shops don’t have a lead problem — they have a ServiceTitan graveyard problem. Paid leads pile up while phones explode during heat waves, and real replacement revenue slips through the cracks because follow-up can’t keep up.

Through our 90-Day Lead Revival Sprint, we run a risk-free pilot on a focused slice of your database to prove results first. When it works, we scale into a 24/7 Lead Revival Engine that:

• Reactivates older ServiceTitan leads with smart, SMS-first outreach
• Qualifies opportunities before they hit your sales team
• Books callbacks and replacement estimates automatically
• Handles new and after-hours leads instantly
• Integrates directly inside your existing CRM

We operate on a performance-based model — we win when you win.

The goal is simple: unlock replacement jobs already sitting in your database, then protect every new lead so nothing slips through again.
Most businesses pay for leads but lose thousands due to:
❌ Slow or missed follow-ups
❌ Unqualified leads wasting their sales team’s time
❌ Assuming old leads are “dead” when they’re still valuable

💡 We solve this by:
✔️ Using AI sales bots to engage and qualify past leads automatically
✔️ Booking sales-ready appointments directly into your calendar
✔️ Operating on a pay-for-performance model—we only get paid when you do

Windsor, Ontario, Canada · Hybrid
🚀 Our clients see more revenue, higher conversion rates, and a predictable sales pipeline—all without extra work on their end.

📩 Message me to learn how we can help you recover lost sales.

about:
Globally Experienced Marketing Leader and Innovator 
I thrive by stepping outside my comfort zone to drive growth, innovation, and large-scale transformations. I've been at the forefront of digital transformation in multiple industries, with 19+ year career across six countries in the following cities - London, Moscow, New York, Prague, Yerevan, and Almaty.

My expertise lies in aligning sales and marketing efforts, leveraging data insights, and harnessing the power of the latest technology solutions for improved customer satisfaction, conversions, and revenue.

🔹 Innovative Problem Solving - Identified and implemented industry-leading solutions to spur organizational change. As a hands-on leader, I guide company transformations, re-designing operations for enhanced effectiveness and efficiency. My focus on customer and data insights has consistently informed business decisions and my negotiation skills have proven invaluable in driving strategic initiatives.

🔹 Delivered Results - As the driving force behind numerous successful campaigns and initiatives throughout my career, demonstrated my ability to manage large-scale projects across digital marketing channels. 

🔹 Leadership - My leadership style is characterized by empathy and transparency. I place the best interests of employees and customers at the heart of my decisions. I'm known for being an easy-going team player who's not afraid to admit when I don't know something. But more importantly, I'm known for finding the answers or solutions to pressing business problems.

🔹 Adaptable - In a world rapidly shifting from relationship-based to digital businesses, I've found my passion in transforming marketing teams into highly efficient, effective units. I'm energized by the opportunity to lead, innovate, and grow in this ever-evolving landscape. I'm motivated by the potential to impact organizations, industries, and revenues significantly.

☑️ Drove Business Efficiency: Developed and implemented strategic media plans, successfully reducing media costs by threefold and doubling ROI.

☑️ Amplified Lead Generation: Led impactful initiatives, fostering alignment between Marketing and Sales departments that resulted in a remarkable 117% increase in Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs) and a 55% boost in form submissions, saving 19 hours monthly on operational tasks.

☑️ Boosted Brand Metrics: Leveraged advertising and marketing expertise to enhance key brand metrics significantly, improving brand positioning and visibility.

experiences.title: VP, Head of Media Planning and Effectiveness of B2B Marketing
experiences.jobDescription:
In my role at HSBC Bank USA, I have consistently demonstrated adaptability, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

I spearheaded the introduction of a data unification platform that enabled a holistic view of our customers by seamlessly integrating business, marketing, offline operations, and online data. This innovative approach significantly enhanced our contact strategy and media activations, improving customer engagement and business performance.

As a team leader, I championed the implementation of multiple marketing technology solutions. These strategic initiatives shortened our sales cycle and led to a notable increase in conversions. Most importantly, it enriched our customer experience, strengthening our brand reputation and customer loyalty.

In addressing challenges, my problem-solving abilities were instrumental in boosting customer conversions on our public website. I initiated customizing landing pages to align with customer journeys based on real-time interactions. This personalized approach resulted in a more intuitive and engaging user experience, increasing conversions and customer satisfaction.

Through these achievements, I have continually evolved our marketing strategies to meet changing business needs and customer expectations, driving growth and success for HSBC Bank USA.

updates.postText:
Stop trying to be just a “relationship seller.”
Start thinking more like a GTM engineer.

B2B Tech Sales is stuck in a false binary:
human seller vs AI seller.

That framing is wrong — and it’s costing deals.

The top revenue teams heading into 2026 aren’t robots or schmoozers.

They’re h͟y͟b͟r͟i͟d͟s͟.

A new profile is emerging: the GTM Engineer.

Why the shift?
1. Efficiency is broken
Reps lose 70–80% of their time to admin and prep. If you’re not engineering your way out of that shadow job, you’re maintaining systems — not selling.

2. Relevance is mandatory
73% of B2B buyers avoid vendors that send irrelevant outreach. Spray-and-pray doesn’t just fail — it repels.

3. The upside is real
Teams using AI-driven workflows see 3.3× higher quota attainment.

Here’s the twist most people miss. You don’t automate to replace relationships. You automate to protect them.

AI should handle scale, memory, and precision so you can handle judgment, trust, and timing. And that “human” part? It’s becoming more valuable:
• 75% of buyers will prefer human interaction by 2030
• 74% of buying teams experience unhealthy conflict during decisions
  
The divide isn’t AI vs human.

It’s 𝘦𝘯𝘨𝘪𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘳𝘴 vs 𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘮𝘦𝘥 𝘰𝘯𝘦𝘴.

Use AI to remove friction —
so you can show up where a pulse still matters.

♻️ Repost to help someone in your network
🔔 Follow Barry Flanagan for daily AI + Tech Sales insights

Discovery isn’t broken. B2B sellers are showing up unprepared.

“So tell me about your business.”
“What keeps you up at night?”
“Who else needs to sign off?”

Opening a call this way in 2026 is not discovery.
It is unpaid labor for a buyer who already did the work.

Buyers arrive informed, impatient, and skeptical.
That is not an attitude issue.
It is the environment now.

According to the 2026 AI-Amplified Selling Report, 73 percent of B2B buyers avoid suppliers who ask generic questions or send irrelevant outreach.

They can learn what your product does without you.
What they need is help pressure-testing their situation.

The job of discovery has shifted.

Strong sellers do the basics before the call.
They use AI to build context.
Financials, expansion plans, tooling, recent decisions.

They arrive with a h͟y͟p͟o͟t͟h͟e͟s͟i͟s͟.

The old approach sounds like this:
“What are your top priorities this quarter?”

The buyer explains their business.
Trust drops.

A better approach sounds like this:
“I saw you’re expanding into EMEA. In this category, that often breaks compliance workflows. Is that what you’re seeing, or has it shown up somewhere else?”

Now the buyer reacts instead of explains.
AI does not replace discovery.
It replaces showing up blind.

When preparation is cheap, arriving cold is a choice.

Discovery works better when you bring a point of view and let the buyer correct it, instead of asking them to build the context for you.

♻️ Repost to help someone in your network
🔔 Follow Barry Flanagan for daily AI + Tech Sales insights

I had the privilege of reporting directly to Barry Flanagan during his time as SVP of Sales, and it was one of the most impactful experiences of my career. Barry is a dynamic and visionary leader who brings out the best in every member of his team. Barry has an exceptional talent for navigating complex sales challenges and translating them into actionable strategies that inspire confidence and deliver results. Under his leadership, I grew not only in my ability to close deals but also in my understanding of the bigger picture—how to align customer needs with our business goals. Barry's mentorship was instrumental in sharpening my skills and shaping my approach to sales and leadership.

What sets Barry apart is his exceptional leadership and ability to drive success through clear vision and strategic focus. He leads with confidence and precision, ensuring the team always understands the path forward and the goals to achieve. His charisma, integrity, and steadfast work ethic made him a role model, and his insights continue to influence my approach to challenges today.

I am very grateful for the opportunity to have worked with Barry and would recommend him without hesitation to any organization seeking a transformative leader who can deliver results and inspire greatness!

recommendationsReceived.name: Douglas Brown
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Vice President of Community at ControlUp
recommendationsReceived.context: Douglas worked with Barry but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description:
I first came upon the name Barry Flanagan in the late 90s. He was a Citrix SE and one of the few in the world sharing and teaching the virtues and tech of End-User Computing technologies. When I joined Citrix in 2001, he was one of the people I was so excited and nervous to meet. Since that day, Barry has been a true friend, honest, helpful, and kind. He has taught me more about life than tech/business, yet he taught me so much about the latter. Barry has always been at the top of my hero list. A wonderful man. A truly remarkable human. 

Since those early days, I have enjoyed watching him grow beyond being SEs together, never losing his humanity. Wherever he has gone, success follows. From those days at Citrix to working together at ControlUp, Barry has shown true leadership. Barry also played a critical role in ControlUp's rapid rise. 

However, Barry is more than just kind and helpful to me. He takes this time with everyone. Many people would say the same as I do. Barry's wake through our industry is untold. He is humble. I will sure sing his praises, as so many of us do. 

Barry humbles me. I don't have the proper words to express what I think of him and how he has affected my life. I've met many people over my 25 years in this industry. Barry is the one I have the most respect for, as he continues to earn it and be the best person I have met in this industry. There is nobody I can recommend more than Barry Flanngan. He is my HERO.

recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working alongside Barry during my tenure as EVP of Marketing at ControlUp, where he led the Americas and APAC Sales teams with dedication and skill. Barry's strategic vision and leadership were instrumental in propelling our Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in these regions by an astonishing 17X over five years—a testament to his ability to drive growth and navigate the complexities of international markets.

Under Barry's stewardship, the sales team expanded from a modest group of seven to a formidable force of 40 dedicated professionals. His commitment to fostering a culture of excellence and continuous improvement was evident in the way he maintained a remarkably low churn rate and significantly outperforming the industry average. This achievement alone speaks volumes about Barry's understanding of customer needs and his ability to build lasting relationships.

Barry's was a great business partner. His strategic initiatives, such as the implementation of the MEDDIC Sales Qualification process across the Americas Sales team, set new standards for efficiency and effectiveness in our sales operations. His innovative "Pain Prompter" tool helped change our approach to pain discovery and enabled our team to better identify and address customer challenges. 

Barry is a visionary leader whose contributions have left an indelible mark on ControlUp and me. His blend of strategic foresight, operational excellence, and dedication to team development made him an invaluable business partner. I wholeheartedly recommend Barry for any leadership role in sales and business development, confident that he will bring the same level of commitment, innovation, and success to his future endeavors.

I truly look forward to the opportunity to work with him again.

I was a direct report for Barry under the America Sales team focused on East NA + LatAm territories. We started on the same day and instantly began a productive working relationship focused on achieving key wins for the company and scaling processes to increase our odds of closing deals.

Barry was a fantastic sounding board and mentor for any stage in the sales process and was keen on propping up his sales team to succeed. His lack of micromanagement and extensive rope to get deals done yielded excellent results for our team, and I was always pleasantly surprised on the tact and effectiveness of his leadership style.

On a last note, it’s always worth noting a leader who has patience when things don’t turn out as planned. Throughout the sales cycle, there are plenty of ups with some losses along the way, and I always admired Barry’s ability to see through the short term troughs. His constant support and willingness to see eye-to-eye is a rare managerial trait and I’m honored to have had the opportunity to work with him on a 1:1 level.

In conclusion, Barry is an excellent sales manager and leader, and I look forward to an opportunity to collaborate again.

recommendations.name: Alexander Rublowsky
recommendations.subtitle: CMO | Fractional | Product Marketing | Product-Led Growth and GTM Strategist | Transformation Driver | Brand & Category Builder | SDR/BDR Leader
recommendations.context: Barry worked with Alexander but on different teams
recommendations.description:
I am writing to offer my recommendation for Alex Rublowsky, with whom I had the pleasure of working closely during my tenure as VP of Americas & APAC Sales at ControlUp. As the EVP of Marketing, Alex was very well versed in driving profitable core business growth and establishing ControlUp's position as a leader in the Digital Employee Experience (DEX) category.

Alex's strategic contributions were instrumental in shaping our company's success. His leadership in building a targeted Product-Led Growth strategy, aligned with an early adopter sales motion across North America and EMEA, resulted in a remarkable 62% growth in High Intent Leads and an impressive 44% year-over-year growth in sales demo meetings. These achievements underscore Alex's keen strategic insights and ability to execute initiatives that drive tangible business outcomes.

Furthermore, Alex played a pivotal role in building ControlUp's brand identity. Through innovative campaigns and targeted analyst relations, he successfully positioned the company within the burgeoning DEX category, enhancing our market presence and differentiation.

Alex's proficiency in aligning go-to-market strategies with industry leaders such as Citrix, VMWare, and Microsoft was excellent. His focus on product alignment and execution of an Account-Based Marketing strategy facilitated joint account planning efforts, resulting in accelerated sales growth.

In summary, Alex Rublowsky is a highly talented and results-driven professional who possesses a combination of strategic vision, analytical acumen, determination and a great work ethic. His leadership and contributions played a significant role in our success at ControlUp, and I do not doubt that he will continue to excel in any endeavor he pursues.

headline: Identity Security Consultant
about:
🚀 From Gadget Sales to Global Sales Strategist: My Journey to Excellence 🚀

It all began in the bustling marketplaces where I sold gadgets—some working, some on their last legs—to fund my university education. Here, I discovered not just my knack for selling, but a passion for understanding and meeting client needs that resonates through my approach today.

🌎 Over the past 5+ years, I've honed this talent globally, driving sales targets and spearheading team success across startups and major players in the United States, Europe, Africa, and Asia. From launching ambitious new verticals to crafting dynamic sales strategies, my career is a testament to the power of dedication and innovation.

💡 Industry Expertise:

Software Sales (SaaS) & (PAAS)
Tech Sales (IT Sales)
AR and VR Sales
Cybersecurity
Marketing & Advertising
Real Estate
Medical Sales

I thrive on challenges—whether introducing cutting-edge products to new markets or nurturing longstanding business relationships. My approach is simple: be tenacious, be curious, and always aim to exceed the expectations set before me.

🔍 Leadership & Connection:
As a leader, my greatest joy comes from managing and mentoring diverse sales teams, drawing insights from global professionals, and continuously pushing my boundaries to not only meet but redefine industry standards.

🌟 Each day is an opportunity to grow—a chance to become a better professional, and more importantly, a better human being. Let’s connect, explore possibilities, and drive success together.

recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working with Dan during his tenure at Introhive where Dan was our VP of Marketing focused on our brand, demand generation, and digital marketing efforts. After joining our team in 2018, Dan quickly showcased his talents and became a strategic partner to the Sales organization. Dan is a strategic thinker, a well rounded people leader, and someone who you can count on to work at a strategic level while rolling up his sleeves to support his team and execute on the task at hand. I would highly recommend Dan and would welcome the opportunity to work together again.

During his 5 years at Introhive, Dan demonstrated an unwavering commitment to driving business growth through strategic marketing initiatives. His ability to develop and execute effective marketing programs have been instrumental in generating high-quality demand within the company’s ideal customer profile, strategic verticals and our expanding customer base.

Dan has always been an integral part of our cross-functional team where he consistently collaborated with sales, business development, and customer success leadership to ensure that marketing efforts are aligned with our growth strategy. His strong leadership skills have enabled our teams to work seamlessly together to achieve shared goals and deliver exceptional results.

One of the most significant contributions Dan has made to our company was his focus on data-driven marketing and building Introhive’s presence as the market leader in the Customer Intelligence SaaS segment. Through his keen insights and expertise in marketing growth strategies, we implemented targeted campaigns that resulted in increased pipeline generation and accelerated deal velocity for the Sales organization. This lead to 66% growth in 2020 where we pivoted our go to market motions to focus more on our customers at a time where there was uncertainty in the world and new logos were difficult to acquire. 

His marketing leadership was not only effective in acquiring new customers but also helped Introhive grow our existing customer accounts. By understanding the needs, pain points of our customer base and being able to deliver value based positioning, Dan and his team were able to develop targeted campaigns that resulted in higher retention rates and increased upsell opportunities. Dan’s ability to adapt to changing customer demands and market conditions shows how strong his business acumen is and how dedicated he is to executing key deliverables and results. 

Overall, I can confidently say that Dan has been an invaluable member of our team, and his contributions have been critical to our success over the last 5 years. I highly recommend Dan for any senior-level marketing position and am confident that he will bring exceptional value to any organization fortunate enough to have them on board.

experiences.title: Chairman

PlayerCoach360 is a world-first 24/7 behavioral profiling, mental resilience, education and support platform that never sleeps and gives players, coaches and parents the performance edge. Our unique platform builds your own personal profile to deliver data driven insights and coaching that improves performance in and out of sports thus enhancing the entire youth sports experience for all stakeholders.

PlayerCoach360 is already working with amateur, semi-pro and professional sports clubs in the UK and have recently been endorsed by the EFL. We are concurrently working with schools and soon colleges/universities, military sports and large associations and governing bodies. 

Our mission is to democratize access to mental resilience, education and support and our passion to serve and business model allows us to put a 24/7 sports performance and mental resilience support team in the pockets of all of our users for as little as $14.99 per user per year and coaches and parents get their own version for free. High volume deals are also negotiable.

Indeed, many of our users and partners become white labelled on-sellers of our offering and not only satisfy their membership but make PlayerCoach360 a new profit center through our community revenue share model.

experiences.title: Strategic Talent Acquisition, People Performance and Commercial Advisor to CEO and Board Web3
experiences.jobDescription:
• Acted as a trusted advisor to startups and companies focused on rapid scaling, enhancing their talent acquisition strategies.  
• Specialized in strategic sourcing, recruitment, and talent management to optimize people performance. Focusing on all sorts of roles from software engineers to full C Suites.
• Developed and executed go-to-market strategies, contributing to business development and revenue creation.  
• Conducted market mapping and competitor analysis to inform business operations and new product development.

experiences.title: Consulting Director Robert Half Salaried Professionals
experiences.jobDescription: Took over the underperforming salaried professionals consulting arm of Robert Half and turned it around before being furloughed due to Covid.

experiences.title: Founder & Director
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsibilities
 
Hidden Resources Market became a world first market mapping company to the International Mining/Engineering Industry. Clients were fed up of highly reactive recruiters only placing job adverts and making a few proactive calls to try and fill their roles and their high fees. Moreover they were fed up of recruiters wanting every company as a client meaning that many talent pools were now off limits given inherent conflicts of interests. 
 
To solve this problem we commissioned a team of researchers to map and build a database of all C-suite/key person risk roles across every international mining/engineering company. This database was hand built through powerful search algorithms that made large scale recruitment systems like ADAPT look clunky and outdated. This game was all about intelligence and speed. This unique database mapped entire organizations and held detailed maps and information meaning that we could access and headhunt them quickly for our clients. 
 
Once the database was built we would offer our services to some 10 companies only who would employ us and pay us monthly on a 3 year contract to be their outsourced talent acquisition team and bring to them the org charts and candidates from their competitors at an affordable price within a record turnaround time. We believed in an ideal fusion of research, mapping, headhunting and the emerging use of social media to source,acquire and retain the best talent for our clients. HRM drew a line in the sand and was a gun for hire for select companies in the "war for talent".  
 
Accomplishments 
 
We managed to create a world first recruitment platform and model for select clients to massively improve not only their talent acquisition goals but to ensure post-placement fall out rarely happened thanks to our investment and meticulous psychological profiling and needs analysis work done at the front, middle and back end of assignments.

experiences.title: Founder & CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsibilities 
 
Hidden Market Consulting was an innovative talent acquisition and HR consulting  company focused on financial and technology staffing. Through research, organizational mapping, neuroscience, behavioral mechanics and superior service HMC quickly became a trusted advisor to top level candidates and then multiple loyal clients. We employed cutting edge sourcing skills using online methodologies, social media, and psychology based headhunting skills. 
 
I built the company from the ground up and was responsible for global talent acquisition for a diverse range of global clients from PE/VC’s, Mining/Engineering,Technology, Healthcare.
 
Some key responsibilities included: 
 
The design and implementation of global talent acquisition strategies for my clients to support explosive growth for C Suite down to lower level roles in new and high growth businesses.
End to end talent acquisition and innovative sourcing methodologies. 
Implementation of new methods to attract passive as well as active candidates. 
Training an elite team of talent acquisition experts. 
Training client business managers to best represent the company whilst interviewing key hires. 
Building an innovative recruitment database and CRM from scratch taking best practice from existing systems whilst bringing our own ideas/innovation. 
Conducting regular reviews with department directors on employee and management satisfaction as well as delivering reports on satisfaction and retention along with other key metrics. 
Extensive consulting with management to understand their priorities and needs and to establish short term and long-range talent acquisition and succession planning. 
Advising clients on the best in house recruitment systems and databases to run and manage to ensure high service levels for all concerned in this end to end process. 
Managing in house recruitment projects for key clients as well as helping them deal with other recruitment agencies in different verticals.

experiences.title: Division Manager & Ex Worldwide Perm No 1 recruiter in 2007.
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsibilities 

In my time at RHI, I spent 15 months in London before launching the Brisbane Australia office with Richard Dunks in late 2005. I recruited and placed staff to executive level accounting and finance professionals. I built the permanent staffing division from scratch and built a highly successful team of consultants whilst achieving my personal placement/billing goals to lead from the front. In my first full year in 2006 I became the number 1 producer in Australasia from a cold desk and then achieved my ultimate individual goal in 2007 of becoming the Worldwide No 1 recruiter for RHI. This was a feat never achieved outside of the USA nor with responsibility for a divisional team in a cold market. This was the goal I had set myself before moving on to launch my own companies shortly after in 2008. During my tenure I became a trusted advisor to many candidates and clients and seeded my ideals for success around targeting a "hidden market" of highly sought after passive job seekers. My future companies were successful as they were built around this ethos and other innovative differentiating ideas built around the application of neuroscience, NLP and behavioral/motivational psychology and it's application in the career space. 
 
Accomplishments 

Became the number 1 producer in Australasia with a cold desk billing $875,000 and in a start up in 2006. 
Became the number 1 producer in the WORLD the following year in 2007 billing $1,250,000 whilst also building a top performing team of 5 with total billings of $3,100,000

about:
Spencer Parikh is a founder and GTM systems builder focused on engineering scalable revenue infrastructure for B2B companies.

With 20+ years of experience across go-to-market, sales, marketing, and business development, Spencer has worked with companies at multiple growth stages helping founders and executives move from fragmented execution to structured, repeatable growth systems.

His work centers on designing AI-first sales and GTM architectures, including outbound systems, RevOps infrastructure, and automation-led workflows that replace manual effort with intelligent orchestration. Spencer is known for combining strategic clarity with hands-on execution turning complex revenue challenges into practical, deployable systems.

Today, he leads DevCommX, where he partners with founders and GTM leaders to build signal-driven, scalable revenue engines designed for modern B2B growth.

updates.postText:
Deploy an AI SDR in 2 hours (playbook)

Most teams think building an AI SDR takes months and a huge dev stack.
It doesn’t.

We deployed ours in under 2 hours, and it now runs 24/7 - qualifying leads, sending personalized outreach, and booking meetings.

Here’s the exact 2-hour playbook 👇

1) Capture Buying Signals (30 mins)

▪️Use n8n webhooks to catch ICP triggers: form fills, LinkedIn engagement, product signups.
▪️Feed enriched leads directly into a simple Google Sheet or CRM.

2) Auto-Enrich + Score (20 mins)

▪️Plug into Clay / Clearbit / People Data Labs APIs.
▪️Add role, company size, tech stack.
▪️Function node scores leads on fit + intent.

3) Personalize at Scale (30 mins)

▪️OpenAI / Claude nodes write custom first-liners based on the lead’s trigger.
▪️Messages feel human, not templated.

4) Multichannel Outreach (20 mins)

▪️Push to Smartlead / Instantly.ai / #Apollo.
▪️Sequence via email + LinkedIn with smart delays.
▪️Embed Calendly link for frictionless booking.

5) Auto-Sync + Alert (20 mins)

▪️HubSpot / Attio node logs all activities.
▪️Slack/ #Teams pings AE with context the moment a lead replies.

The Results:
Our AI SDR runs non-stop, responds in minutes, and books meetings while we sleep.
No additional headcount. No manual prospecting.

Want the full 2-hour playbook + JSON templates we use?

 👉 Comment “AI SDR” and I’ll DM you the setup.

Most VPs of Sales buy LinkedIn automation tools.
Smart sales leaders hire people who already know what they’re doing.

It’s easy to buy software.
It’s harder to build judgment.

Every quarter, I see teams spending thousands on automation platforms -
hoping technology will fix what a lack of experience broke.

But tools don’t replace intuition.
They amplify it.

A great rep doesn’t need 10 tabs open.
They need clarity on:
→ Who’s ready to buy
→ What problem to lead with
→ Why timing matters more than volume

Because the truth is - automation only works if your fundamentals do.

If your messaging’s off, automation just spreads the wrong story faster.
If your targeting’s unclear, AI will just deliver it to the wrong people - efficiently.

Here’s what the best sales leaders do differently 👇
 They don’t ask, “What tool should we buy?”
 They ask, “Who already knows how to win here?”

Because great systems don’t start with software.
They start with people who understand the why behind every workflow.

If you’re building a team that wants predictable pipeline - start with strategy, not subscriptions.
We’ve documented how to align people + process + platform into one GTM motion.
Comment “PLAYBOOK” and I’ll share it.

99% of LinkedIn profiles leave pipeline on the table.
After generating $3.2M+ in ARR from organic, here’s the system we built ↓

🔹  What’s inside:

The same system that helped us
→ Turn a single profile into a $3M+ sales engine
→ Build 7+ active inbound funnels from LinkedIn
→ Convert C-suite comments into SQLs
→ Replace outbound messages with inbound meetings
→ Launch multiple GTM brands with zero paid ads

This isn’t about “posting more.”
It’s about turning attention into revenue.

Here’s what you’ll learn:
→ How we built buyer-led content loops using AI signals
→ The exact messaging layer that converts ICP engagement into booked meetings
→ Why your LinkedIn profile is the strongest sales asset you’re underusing

Most profiles sell what they do.
The best profiles sell what the buyer wants next.

If your LinkedIn presence isn’t generating pipeline -
you don’t need a new content plan.
You need a conversion system.

🔸 Want access?
1️⃣ Like this post to amplify reach
2️⃣ Comment “LinkedIn” and I’ll send you The GTM LinkedIn System

♻️ Repost this if you believe LinkedIn should be your top revenue channel in 2025.

The 2025 Sales Era: What Skills Will Keep You Ahead of the Curve

Sales isn’t slowing down.
It’s compounding - faster tech, shorter cycles, smarter buyers.

And yet, most sales pros are still playing by 2020 rules.
If you want to stay relevant in 2025 and beyond, here’s what actually matters:

1️⃣ The Go-To-Market Engineer

The SDR role is evolving, fast.
The new sales pro builds systems, not spreadsheets.

They know how to:
 🔸 Automate outreach with n8n
 🔸 Build deliverability-proof email infrastructure
 🔸 Score and route leads using Clay + HubSpot
 🔸 Write copy that converts intent into meetings

One full-stack GTM operator can now outperform an entire traditional SDR pod.
That’s the future of sales execution.

2️⃣ AI as a Sales Copilot

AI isn’t taking jobs, it’s multiplying output.

Teams using Clay, Instantly.ai, Relevance AI aren’t replacing reps.
They’re giving them leverage.

The best salespeople now treat AI like a teammate, not a crutch.
They ask better questions, move faster, and make better decisions.

3️⃣ Brand > Cold Outreach

If you’re not building a digital footprint, you’re invisible.

2025 buyers don’t reply to strangers. They reply to voices they already trust.
That’s why top sales teams now treat LinkedIn as a channel, not a hobby.

Your content opens doors your cold emails can’t.

4️⃣ The Full-Stack AE Returns

AI is automating prospecting, but not closing.

The new AE owns the entire funnel:
 → Discovery → Demo → Negotiation → Close

The best operators combine empathy with data.
They sell without friction, because they understand every layer of the GTM stack.

5️⃣ Personalization at Scale = Table Stakes

Templates are dead. Context wins.

The new playbook:
AI finds the data.
You bring the story.

Together, they make every message feel handcrafted.
That’s how real connection scales.

In 2025, the best sales pros won’t choose between human skill and technical skill. They’ll master both.

The advantage belongs to those who blend systems, storytelling, and strategy.

Want the complete GTM Skills Blueprint 2025 (roles, stacks & frameworks)?
Comment “SKILLS” and I’ll send you the full breakdown.
